uuc=0490|ulc=0491}} 'Ghe with upturn' (Ò Ò; italics: Ò Ò  ) is a letter of the Cyrillic script. In Ukrainian,
Urum and Rusyn, this letter is called "Ghe", and the letter â¹Ðâº is called "He".
In Unicode this letter is called "Ghe with upturn".

The letterform of Ghe with upturn is based on the Cyrillic letter Ghe
(Ð Ð³), but its handwritten and italic lowercase forms do not follow the
italic modification of Ge ( Ð³ ).

It represents the voiced velar plosive , like the pronunciation of â¹gâº
in "'g'o".

Ghe with upturn is romanized using the Latin letter G (but with an additional
grave accent in ISO 9).
